Veludvāreyya Sutta：The brahmins and householders of Veludvāra visit the Buddha when he comes to their village and ask for a teaching which will be profitable to them．The Buddha points out to them the advantages of keeping the five precepts：

abstention from taking life， from theft，etc． avoidance of slander， harsh speech and frivolous talk， and of having faith in the Buddha，the Dhamma and the Sangha．S．v．352f．
